intro: Arabis muralis var. cretica, commonly known as the Cretan wallflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the island of Crete. It typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow, four-petaled flowers. It is well adapted to harsh environments and is often used in rock gardens or as a border plant. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation.
